index_desc: EVAonline is a browser-based platform for calculating reference evapotranspiration (ET₀) using the FAO-56 Penman-Monteith model, designed for data-scarce regions like Brazil’s MATOPIBA.
index_explore: Explore the Usage Guide for step-by-step instructions on using the Home and Calculate ETo pages.
getting_started_desc: Learn how to set up and use EVAonline for ET₀ calculations.
prereq_browser: A modern web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge).
prereq_internet: Internet connection to access EVAonline and retrieve data from NASA POWER, Open-Meteo, or INMET.
prereq_coordinates: Knowledge of the geographic coordinates or city for ET₀ calculation (optional).
visit_site_desc: Open the EVAonline platform in your browser (link to be provided upon deployment).
navigate_home_desc: Explore maps to select coordinates or visualize geographic data.
proceed_calculate_desc: Click the "Calculate ET₀" button to start calculations.
setup_local_desc: To run EVAonline locally, follow these steps:
install_deps_desc: Run pip install -r requirements.txt to install Python dependencies (e.g., Streamlit, Folium).
run_app_desc: Execute streamlit run src/Home.py to start the local server.

usage_desc: This guide explains how to use EVAonline to calculate reference evapotranspiration (ET₀) using the FAO-56 Penman-Monteith model. Start on the Home page to explore maps and select coordinates, then proceed to the Calculate ETo page to perform calculations and view results.
select_map_desc: Choose a map to visualize geographic data or select coordinates:
map_all_cities_desc: Displays all municipalities in the MATOPIBA region with a perimeter outline.
map_piracicaba_desc: Shows the city of Piracicaba with INMET station coordinates.
map_inmet_desc: Displays INMET weather stations with filters for automatic or conventional stations.
map_global_desc: Allows clicking to select coordinates anywhere in the world.
filter_inmet_desc: If you choose the INMET Stations map, use checkboxes to filter:
capture_coordinates_desc: Click on the Global Map to capture coordinates (latitude and longitude), then click Calculate ET₀ to proceed to the Calculate ETo page.
choose_calc_mode_desc: Select the calculation mode from the dropdown menu:
global_mode_desc: Calculate ET₀ using coordinates from the Home page map or manual input.
matopiba_mode_desc: Calculate ET₀ for a specific city in the MATOPIBA region.
define_coordinates_desc: Depending on the mode, you have the following options:
use_home_coords_desc: Apply coordinates captured on the Home page.
click_map_desc: Select coordinates on an interactive map.
manual_input_desc: Enter latitude (-90 to 90) and longitude (-180 to 180).
select_city_desc: Choose a state and city from dropdown menus.
manual_input_desc_matopiba: Enter coordinates within the MATOPIBA region (-14.5 to -2.5 lat, -50.0 to -41.5 long).
select_data_source_desc: Choose a data source (NASA POWER, Open-Meteo Archive, Open-Meteo Forecast, INMET) and specify the start and end dates.
confirm_parameters_desc: Review the selected parameters (mode, coordinates, data source, dates, elevation) and click Confirm. Adjust the elevation if needed.
calculate_eto_desc: Click the Calculate ET₀ button to generate results. Results are displayed in two tabs: Table and Graphs and Statistics.
view_results_desc: Explore results in the following tabs:
table_desc: Displays ET₀ and climatic variables (e.g., temperature, radiation, humidity).
graph_eto_vs_temp_rad_prec: ET₀ vs. Temperature vs. Radiation vs. Precipitation
inmet_filters_desc: if INMET Stations map is selected
coordinate_capture_desc: Click on the Global Map to capture coordinates for ET₀ calculation.
global_mode_options: Use coordinates from Home, click on map, or manual input (latitude -90 to 90, longitude -180 to 180).
matopiba_mode_options: Select state/city or manual input within region bounds (-14.5 to -2.5 lat, -50.0 to -41.5 long).
data_source_options: NASA POWER, Open-Meteo Archive, Open-Meteo Forecast, INMET.
date_range_desc: Select start and end dates for data retrieval.
elevation_adjustment_desc: Automatically retrieved or manually adjusted (-1000 to 9000 meters).
statistics_desc: View daily data, descriptive stats, normality tests, and more.
